question: Who among the following British officers of Delhi killed during the Revolt of 1857?
explanation: On May 10, 1857, in Merrut, the Great Indian Mutiny of 1857 was broked out in open rebellion. The Indian sepoys marched towards Delhi and proclaimed Bahadur Shah Zafar as Emperor of India. The British officer Colonel Ripley was killed at Delhi by his own troops.The public welcomed the soldiers and supported the revolt.
